id: Aerosmith’s Joe Perry is ‘alert and responsive’ after ‘collapsing’ at Billy Joel concert
paragraph: 135.6m sharesAerosmith’s Joe Perry is ‘alert and responsive’ after being rushed to hospital.The 68-year-old was taken for treatment after collapsing, following a performance of Walk This Way, with Billy Joel, live at Madison Square Gardens in New York.But, despite still being in hospital, his rep revealed the guitarist would be back on stage later this month.A statement from Marcee Rondan read: ‘Following a guest performance during Billy Joel’s show last night at Madison Square Garden, Joe Perry experienced shortness of breath and was treated backstage by paramedics who gave the guitarist oxygen and used a tracheal tube to clear his airway before taking him to a hospital.‘This morning Perry remains in the hospital where he is alert and responsive. The Aerosmith guitarist will be unable to appear today at Rock And Roll Fantasy Camp in Florida and apologises to those attending.‘Perry is expected to return to the road later this month.’Joe collapsed on 10 November, after performing Walk This Way with Billy Joel, and was later wheeled out of the arena.An insider later told TMZ paramedics ‘put a tracheal tube down his throat to clear the airway’, and that he ‘did not look good’.It has since been alleged that Joe has had ‘breathing issues for the last few weeks’ related to congestion.Jessie J hasn't given up on hopes of becoming a mother naturally after refusing a hysterecJustin Bieber finally settles lawsuit for egging neighbour's houseJessica Chastain and husband Gian Luca 'welcome their first child by surrogate'Aerosmith were recently unveiled as the latest act to be given a Las Vegas residency next year, following on in the footsteps of Britney Spears and Celine Dion.The 18-date stint, aptly named Deuces Are Wild, will kick off on 6 April, to coincide with their 50th anniversary.Speaking about the gig, Joe previously vowed: ‘We are going to bring hot, sexy rock and roll to Vegas!!‘The residency allows us to take 50 years of performing experience and create a one of kind show with the best music, best production design, best sound, in a world-class state of the art venue.
